result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Allen Fliess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If not previously done, provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing and pay the DNA fee out of bail on deposit if any with the balance due on or before 03-12-2018. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Court WAIVES all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.

Credit for 75 days. TIME SERVED
Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Fliess

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 75 days TIME SERVED.

THE COURT, if not previously done so, pay the DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any; with the balance due on or before 03-12-2018; and provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. The Court waives all other costs and surcharges. Defendant indigent.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Letter from Probation and Parole Agent, Heather Laurence
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 45.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Nathan Oplan-Dobs for attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Received and filed with the court.
Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Alicia H. Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. NO BAIL FORFEITED.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court ordered the Defense to file all motions, jury instructions, witness lists on or before 06-30-2017.  Jury Trial scheduled for July 31, 2017 at 09:00 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Held of the record. Defense counsel requesting to reschedule final pretrial calendared on 6/12/2017 at 8;30am due to defendant's pending matter in waukesha county scheduled on the same day. 
Court Grants defendant request and ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defednant not produced from Winnebago for purposes of this hearing. Defendant will be released prior to the next hearing.  Pre-trial Conference scheduled for May 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE WINNEBAGO DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, Defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Winnebago Drug Abuse Correctional Center for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Angel Johnson appearing as a friend of the court, Defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Winnebago Drug Abuse Correctional Center (DAK) for purposes of this hearing. Case is adjourned in order for the public defender's office to appoint counsel.  Status of Couonsel scheduled for February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court (as a friend of the court), Defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from The Drug Abuse Correctional Center in Winnebago.  Status of Counsel scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant incarcerated at the Drug Abuse Correctional Center in Winnebago. He is scheduled to complete the Earned Release Program on 03-17-2017. Letter from the Department of Corrections received and filed with the court. The Case is scheduled for a Status of Counsel on 01-20-2017 at 08:30 am in Branch 45.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited. Court ordered August 8, 2016 at 9:00 a.m. jury trial vacated.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody at Ozaukee County Sheriff.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial in Branch 31.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Richard Allen Fliess not in court, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a Status Conference. For reasons stated on the record court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in custody at Ozaukee County Jail and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Jury Trial/Motion Hearing date to convert to a Status Conference in Branch 31. Case remains calendared for March 21, 2016 at 8:30am.

Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 31.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

-State's Requested Jury Instructions from Assistant District Attorney Brittany Kachingwe; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Defense counsel requests a Miranda Goodchild hearing. State requests additional time to produce witnesses. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial, motion hearing and jury trial in Branch 31.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for final pretrial conference.
Case remains in a jury trial posture.  No pending issues remain.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on 12/2/15 at 9:00 am in Branch 37.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated 11/10/15 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests jury trial date. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Teddy K. and ARS Auto Repair Service.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Richard Allen Fliess in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
